title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open a file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If a file is already opened in one editor, it should display an error message when trying to open it in another editor.
OB:
1. Close any open files.
2. Go to the Java Perspective.
3. Open a java file by double-clicking on it.
4. The file is now opened in the workbench.
5. Right-click on the Java file.
6. Select 'Open With' and then 'System Editor'.
7. Nothing happens.
8. There should be a warning message in the workbench indicating that opening the file in another editor may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue. Alternatively, there should be an error message stating that all files need to be closed first.

We believe this is a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
SR:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right-click on the Java file.
3. Select 'Open With' and then 'System Editor'.
4. A Notepad or WordPad window should pop up with the java file opened.
5. Close the Notepad or WordPad window.
6. Go to the Java Perspective.
7. Open a java file by double-clicking on it.
8. The file should now be opened in the workbench.
9. Right-click on the Java file.
10. Select 'Open With' and then 'System Editor'.
11. There should be a warning message in the workbench indicating that opening the file in another editor may overwrite changes and asking if you want to continue. Alternatively, there should be an error message stating that all files need to be closed first.

We believe this is a safety feature where WSAD doesn't allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
